newsitem.title: KENYA: Nairobi bourse index edges upwards in modest trade.
newsitem.headline: Nairobi bourse index edges upwards in modest trade.

text.p: The Nairobi Stock Exchange 20-share index lifted marginally on Monday on modest gains in key shares across the board, bourse officials said.
The index went up 17.96 points to close at 3394.57.
Turnover was posted at 12.6 million shillings on 478,850 shares from 9.712 million shillings on 251,994 shares on Friday.
National carrier Kenya Airways closed at 8.40 from 8.05 while Uchumi Supermarket gained 1.0 to 38.25.
Nation Printers & Publishers was unchanged at 154.
Brooke Bond was unchanged at 123 while Rea Vipingo Plantations closed at 9.05 unchanged.
"No special lots were traded. Today's trading was normal -- like for a Monday, dull," one broker said.
"We're entering into the second quarter of the year, there is not much excitement and most prices are expected to remain low," a market analyst said.
Barclays Bank edged up to 103 from 102 while Kenya Commercial Bank gained a shilling to close at 86.
Kenya Power & Lighting was unchanged at 124 while Total Kenya closed at 65 from 64.50.
Foreigners bought 3,200 shares of National Industrial Credit at 50 unchanged and 10,000 shares of East African Portland Cement at 39.25 from 38.25.
The Central Bank of Kenya floating rate treasury bonds traded 50,000 shillings at 102.3762 percent from 102.2028 percent on Friday.
